alert.note: Alert for East Feliciana; Pointe Coupee; West Baton Rouge; West Feliciana (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 06 at 1:26PM CDT until further notice by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Louisiana, including the following parishes, East Feliciana, Pointe Coupee, West Baton Rouge and West Feliciana. * WHEN...Until 430 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas with water possibly over some roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 125 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... New Roads, St. Francisville, Livonia, Fordoche, Morganza, Batchelor, Wakefield and Lettsworth. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

area.areaDesc: East Feliciana; Pointe Coupee; West Baton Rouge; West Feliciana
